alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Middlesex; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, southwestern Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, east central Charles City, eastern New Kent, southeastern King William and northwestern James City Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Little Plymouth to New Kent. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... West Point and Little Plymouth around 125 PM EDT. Shacklefords around 135 PM EDT. Barhamsville and Saluda around 150 PM EDT. Glenns around 155 PM EDT. Toano and Norge around 200 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Holly Forks, Eltham, Chickahominy Shore, York River State Park, Croaker, Cash, Cohoke, Gressit, Lanexa and Mattaponi. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Middlesex; New Kent
